Business_AssetObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Business_AssetObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Business_AssetObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

OrganizationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

OrganizationObjectID.type: WID,  Company_Reference_ID,  Cost_Center_Reference_ID,  Custom_Organization_Reference_ID,  Organization_Reference_ID,  Region_Reference_ID
OrganizationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

OrganizationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Edit_Data.description: Reference to an existing Company or Company Hierarchy.  Value is read-only and will not be updated upon submission.

validation.validation: Asset ID ([asset id]) has already been used.  Please provide a unique Asset ID value.
The total asset cost entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point
validation.description: The total asset cost entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point

validation.validation: Asset Total Cost change is allowed for expensed assets that are not disposed or removed.
Quantity must be greater than zero.
Quantity change is allowed only on assets that are not disposed or removed or Used By Composite status.
Total new quantity cannot be less than consumed quantity of [consumed]
Quantity cannot be adjusted for Composite Assets.
The asset has a pending composite asset creation event. Either complete or cancel the event to edit the quantity.
Quantity cannot be adjusted for components of a discrete composite asset.
You can't update quantity for the Type and Accounting Method of the Supplier Contract.

Item_DescriptorObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Item_DescriptorObjectID.type: WID,  Catalog_Item_ID,  Catalog_Load_Item_ID,  Expense_Item_ID,  Purchase_Item_ID,  Sales_Item_ID,  Supplier_Item_ID
Item_DescriptorObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Item_DescriptorObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Edit_Data.description: Reference to a purchase item for the asset.

validation.validation: Item ([item]) must be trackable and must match the Spend Category already assigned to the asset ([asset]).

Asset_Edit_Data.description: Asset Identifier can be any identifier for the business asset such as a tag number.

Asset_ClassObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Asset_ClassObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Asset_ClassObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Edit_Data.description: Configured in Maintain Asset Class by users, Asset Class allows for applying an addtional reporting criteria.  Very useful if you are reporting to tax authorities for trackable, depreciating assets.  Field is not required.

validation.validation: This is a Shared Business Asset that is shared by Asset Class. The Asset Class for the Asset Shares can be modified via the Maintain Asset Shares task.

Asset_TypeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Asset_TypeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Asset_TypeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Edit_Data.description: Configured in Maintain Asset Type by users, Asset Type allows for applying an additional layer for  describing assets and also helpful for reporting trackable, depreciating assets.  Field is not required.

validation.validation: This is a Shared Business Asset that is shared by Asset Type. The Asset Type for the Asset Shares can be modified via the Maintain Asset Shares task.
Business Use % must be between 1 and 100.
Business Use Percentage change is not allowed for assets that are disposed or removed.

Cost_CenterObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Cost_CenterObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Cost_CenterObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Edit_Data.description: References the coordinating cost center for reporting only.

validation.validation: Cost Center: [cost center] is not allowed for Company: [company]
validation.description: If the cost center is restricted to a company, then the company on the asset must match the company on the cost center.

validation.validation: Enter an active coordinating cost center.
validation.description: In the worktag configuration for Business Asset, if inactive values are disallowed for cost centers, then the coordinating cost center must be active.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Edit_Data.description: References the asset coordinator for reporting only.

validation.validation: Enter a valid worker who hasn't been terminated.
validation.description: Enter a valid worker who hasn't been terminated.

validation.validation: The company of each component asset must match the company of the asset being registered/composed.
Lease asset cannot be used as a component asset
Component assets used to create a composite asset cannot have an in progress event.
Component assets used to create a composite asset must be tangible.
Composite Asset cannot be composed with other composite assets.
You can't remove this asset component as it's not part of the discrete composite asset: [AssetID]
The selected assets must have the same asset books as the composite asset. Run Add Assets to Company Asset Book to add the existing asset to a new company asset book.
You can't add this asset as a component because it's available quantity is zero: [AssetID].
You can't add this asset as a component because it's available quantity is not equal to approved quantity: [AssetID].
Component assets used to create a composite asset must have a status of "Registered" or if discrete lifecycles option is selected, statuses of In Service, Issued and Out of Service are allowed.

Discrete_Child_Component.description: Asset Identifier. This field cannot be edited.
Supplier Reference Number. This field cannot be edited.
Manufacturer.  This field cannot be edited.

Discrete_Child_Component.description: Item Reference. This field cannot be edited.
Asset Name. This field cannot be edited.
PO Number.  This field cannot be edited.
Receipt Number. This field cannot be edited.

Asset_Edit_Data.description: References to child component assets when the parent is Discrete Composite Asset

validation.validation: You can't add or remove components because this asset: [AssetID] is not a discrete composite asset.
This composite asset has a status of Removed: [AssetID]. You can't add or remove components.
Related assets cannot be the asset itself and must be within the same company.
validation.description: Related assets cannot be the asset itself and must be within the same company.

validation.validation: Related assets must be within the same company.
validation.description: Related assets must be within the same company.

Asset_Edit_Data.description: References to other assets to which this asset is related. Related assets must be within the same company.Related assets can be loaded using the Edit Asset web service or the Asset > Edit related task.

Financials_Attachment_Data.description: Text attribute identifying Content Type of the Attachment.
Text attribute identifying Filename of the Attachment.
Text attribute identifying Encoding of the Attachment.
Boolean attribute identifying whether the Attachment is compressed.

validation.validation: If a file name is specified for a Financial Attachment, File Content and Content Type are required.

description: Data that may be updated using the asset's related task Asset Edit, such as description, name, identifier, serial number, asset class, asset type, asset manufacturer, related assets and attachments.  If any attributes are updated that bonus depreciation rules are based on (e.g. asset type or asset class),  bonus depreciation percent is not defaulted again from bonus depreciation rules.
